standup.title: Give an update to the next person
standup.summary: Each person gives an update to the next person in the team, using their name and making eye contact
standup.description: Go around in a circle, each person gives an update to the next person in the team, using their name and making eye contact. E.g. “Natalie, yesterday I was working on X and today I’ll be doing Y”. The last person then updates the first person.
benefits: Helps the team notice information asymmetry. E.g. it becomes very clear that an engineer uses too much technical jargon in their updates when they have to give their update directly to the visual designer on the team.
This helps team members to focus on useful information. It’s easier to keep an update to the point when you’re talking to a particular person.
